[[Jagdgeschwader 54|JG 54]] |commands=III./JG 54 |battles=[[World War II]] *[[Battle of France]] *[[Battle of Britain]] *[[Invasion of Yugoslavia]] *[[Operation Barbarossa]] *[[Siege of Leningrad]] |awards=[[Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross]] |laterwork=}} '''Arnold Lignitz''' (25 March 1913 – 30 September 1941){{refn|Arnold Lignitz was shot down on 30 September 1941 and may have been captured by Soviet forces before dying in captivity.|group="Note"}} was a [[Germany|German]] ''[[Luftwaffe]]'' [[fighter ace|ace]] and recipient of the [[Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross]] during the [[World War II|Second World War]]. The Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross was awarded to recognize extreme battlefield bravery or successful military leadership. During his career, Lignitz was credited with 25 aerial victories. ==Awards and decorations== * [[Aviator badge]] * [[Front Flying Clasp of the Luftwaffe]] * [[Iron Cross]] (1939) ** 2nd Class ** 1st Class * [[Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross]] on 5 November 1940 as ''[[Oberleutnant]]'' and ''[[Gruppenkommandeur]]'' of the III./Jagdgeschwader 54Fellgiebel 2000, p. 238. ==Notes==
